brightness.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

clahe.quote: I got a significant boost in the f1 scores across all the classes after adding CoarseDropout, CutOut and CLAHE.

coarsedropout.quote: I got a significant boost in the f1 scores across all the classes after adding CoarseDropout, CutOut and CLAHE.

contrast.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

cutmix.quote: Finally using CutMix boosted class 0's and 1's f1-scores.

cutout.quote: I got a significant boost in the f1 scores across all the classes after adding CoarseDropout, CutOut and CLAHE.

horizontalflip.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

hue.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

random-resized-cropping.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping

saturation.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

transpose.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping

tta.quote: I saw an increase in my public score accuracy after using test time augmentations. I used 10 rounds of predictions for each image, where every time random augmentations are applied to it and then the predictions are averaged.

value.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping, random hue, saturation, value,brightness and contrast adjustments.

verticalflip.quote: I started off with the basic image augmentations like random resized cropping, transposing the image, horizontal and vertical flipping

efficientnet-b4.quote: One being ResNet50_32x4 and the other EfficientNet-B4. Both were initialized with pretrained ImageNet weights.

resnext50-32x4d.quote: One being ResNet50_32x4 and the other EfficientNet-B4... resnet_model = models.resnext50_32x4d(pretrained=False)

imagenet.quote: Both were initialized with pretrained ImageNet weights.

crossentropyloss.quote: I tried using a weighted cross entropy loss to overcome the class imbalance, but it did not show any f1-score improvement over cross entropy loss. So I went with the plain cross entropy loss.

sgd.quote: I used SGD optimizer with Cosine Annealing learning rate scheduler, decaying the lr every epoch.

cosine-annealing.quote: I used SGD optimizer with Cosine Annealing learning rate scheduler, decaying the lr every epoch. I also tried cosine annealing with restarts but I saw no reduction in convergence time.

5-fold-stratified.quote: Since the dataset is imbalanced and to maintain the same class distribution across the folds, I used stratified K-fold that makes sure that the percentage of samples for each class are preserved across the folds. I used 5-folds to estimate the best performing model

soft-voting-ensemble.quote: To boost my accuracy I used a soft voting ensemble on my best performing Resnet50_32x4 and EfficientNet-B4 model. I tried a number of weights for combining their predictions. The best score I got with was Resnext50 weighted 0.6 and EfficientNet-B4 weighted 0.4

pytorch.quote: import torch, import torch.nn as nn, from torchvision import models, transforms
